result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:04 AM Defendant Veronica L Hernandez in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein appeared by zoom video for Veronica L Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Letter filed by Atty Klein requesting Zoom**Reviewed by Commissioner Christopher Bailey on 10/11 "GRANTED"
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on September 29, 2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Witness A/Walmart listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to discuss this matter with the co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

2:13 PM Defendant Veronica L Hernandez in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Veronica L Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hughes appears as friend of the court. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
